channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Tree roots continue to lift public footpath and private driveway., 24th October
item.description:
Roots from a council planted tree along the public footpath are lifting the public pavement and the adjacent private drive causing a trip hazard to the public and also causing damage and a trip hazard to the residents of the property. It is my understanding that the past two visits from council workers who attempted to cut back the roots and flatten the surrounding area were unsuccessful and the public footpath and private drive are now lifted by approximately 10” in height due to the prolific growth of the tree roots below.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 36, The Crescent, Park Langley, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Rubbish dumped end of booth close by metal gate, 24th October
item.description:
This has been an ongoing problem. The current rubbish has been there a good few months. Myself and neighbour have been reporting it

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Booth Close, Thamesmead, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Cones reserving parking bays, 24th October
item.description:
Neighbours have been repeatedly saving parking spaces with traffic cones. There is no parking permits or restrictions apart from bays. Cars have been damaged (nothing proved) if cones have been moved and other residents park. This is continuous daily

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Lovel Avenue, East Wickham, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Van full of rubbish has been left for a week., 24th October
item.description:
There has been no sign of movement or anyone using it. It makes it difficult to see oncoming traffic when exiting the drive ways close to the van.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Hayes Lane, Hayes, London

item.title: Illegal parking, dumping and endangering public, 24th October
item.description:
Builder illegally parked in residence bay. Used dangerous power tools in residence bay, illegally dumped saw dust residue into sewer. WCC failed to take action. For info: Using a private electric saw on streets or pavements is illegal and can be considered a criminal offense, especially if it causes a public nuisance or is done without proper precautions Dumping waste into street sewers is illegal and harmful, potentially causing blockages, damaging infrastructure, and polluting waterways. It is an offense to deposit waste into street drains, as this can lead to overflows and back-ups that harm human health and the environment.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 3, Chapter Street, Millbank, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Dog fouling, 24th October
item.description:
There are neighbour from 1st floor of Fermain Court north that have been continuously letting there dog foul outside people’s doorsteps within the estate and not cleaning it. They live somewhere from flat 9 onwards. This has been going on for a month

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Downham Road, Hackney, London

item.title: Illegal parking, dangerous use of resident bay and drain blocking, 24th October
item.description:
Illegal parking in residence bay allowed by WCC all morning for works in Chapter Chambers fflat . White van HL21 WXK still parked in residence bay in afternoon despite being observed by traffic warden 4 hours ago. Builder cut wood with noisy electric saw in paking bay. Builder then pushed all saw dust into sewer already blocked with leaves.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Chapter Street, Millbank, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Tree on pavement, 24th October
item.description:
Due to high winds, tree has fallen onto pavement close to school. This path is used by children and parents on way to and from school and this is a hazard. This happened on 23.10.25 and is located on corner of Kingsley Road and Hazelwood lane n13

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Kingsley Road, Bowes, London
Report on FixMyStreet
